content.prompt: A yearbook company was investigating whether there is a significant difference between two states in the percents of high school students who order yearbooks. From a random sample of 150 students selected from one state, 70 had ordered a yearbook. From a random sample of 100 students selected from the other state, 65 had ordered a yearbook. Which of the following is the most appropriate method for analyzing the results?

choices.label: A one-sample z-test for a sample proportion
A one-sample z-test for a population proportion
A two-sample z-test for a difference in sample proportions
A two-sample z-test for a difference in population proportions
A two-sample z-test for a population proportion

topic.text: 6.10: Setting Up a Test for the Difference of Two Population Proportions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
